text: Freshworks is one of the fastest-growing
SaaS product company,

which has more than
65,000 paying customers
across 100 plus countries.
That poses us all kinds of challenges

that you can go through as a
large SaaS product company.

Enterprise Support with
their best practices,

the learnings that they do
with the larger ecosystem,

different customers,
they are advising for us

time to time to look
at our internal process

and actually give us a
third-party point of view

in terms of what makes
sense for Freshworks,

and together we build that
roadmap of improvement.
And we go ahead and automate
stuff and then take it from there.

So cloud cost for Freshworks
is at the heart of
our entire cloud engineering strategy.

We were able to keep very healthy
gross margins in one of the

most lean and mean organizations
in terms of the cloud cost.
Security is paramount for Freshworks.

So we work very closely
with the Enterprise Support
to be able to understand all our threats,
both internal and external.

So together with Enterprise
Support, we have multiple tools,

systems deployed, to ensure
that we are completely,
secured and protected.
There are multiple examples
where Enterprise Support helped us
bring in technological changes within AWS
that directly or indirectly
impacted our business positively.

One good example I can talk
about is we were missing
a point in time recovery in MySQL.
And this is one gap

that we have been working
with Enterprise Support.
We influenced the product roadmap
and the feature was introduced back to us.
Due to that we were able to deploy
disaster recovery across all the regions
that we are deployed.

I can say very confidently
that we have done
a fantastic job so far
working with together as a team
and making a lot of difference.
